extendedInfo.description: Learn about your favorite artists, find nearby events, and share your music tastes with the Last.fm scrobbler. Optionally sync your Last.fm friends with your contacts.Plus, subscribers in the US, UK, and Germany: Your personal radio station on your phone: Choose an artist or genre and Last.fm builds the perfect playlist just for you!Permissions: â¢ GPS is used to display nearby upcoming events â¢ Contacts and Accounts are used on certain phones to optionally sync your Last.fm friends with your contacts â¢ Calendars are used on certain phones to optionally sync your Last.fm events with your calendar â¢ Logs are used for the built-in bug reporter* Scrobbling of the built-in media players on some Motorola and Samsung phones is not currently supported.  On these devices, you can install a 3rd party media player that supports scrobbling.

reviews.title: shame about the subscription
reviews.comment: I was hoping to use this to listen to radio on my phone, but I just found out that it needs a subscription. I already have a spotify subscription, which is obviously far better, so won\'t be paying for this as well.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good, but room for improvement.
reviews.comment: The app works as advertised, with options such as selecting between the low and high bandwidth/quality streams and access to most options also available online. However, the Pause button on the lock screen does not work, it responds to a headset\'s smart key only to pause but not resume, and if data connectivity was lost - ie you walk into a building with poor reception - it does not automatically resume when it is restored. This requires constant fiddling on the go. Edit 1 May 2013: I\'ve taken it down from 3 to 2 stars. There is quite a frequent need to force-stop the app, and makes it even less enjoyable than it already was (which was poor).
reviews.author: Mike Green

reviews.title: Ugly UI and no free radio.
reviews.comment: The UI still looks like a mobile version of a windows 95 application and there isn\'t a free radio choice. When you do pay you can\'t make a playlist and play only certain songs. I don\'t care to listen to individual songs I can pay 10 bucks and do that on Spotify. It does appear scrobbling has been fixed on ICS. Overall this app is very laggy as well.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Had to reinstall
reviews.comment: After reinstall i love this app. Decided to buy radio for now, i think its better then iheart radio. Love the \"love\" feature, marks songs you like for future purchase.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Really good but...
reviews.comment: ... Artist\'s bio\'s just don\'t display. It used to be really good when I could read about the artists, kind of beats the whole point of scrobbling. Looking to get this sorted out quickly  Cheers.
reviews.author: Austen D\'Souza

reviews.title: Not possible to delete scrobled song from library
reviews.comment: The most important feature, scrobling, works. Sometimes scrobles twice the same song twice, but I\'m not sure whether it is this app or a player\'s fault. What I miss most, is ability to manage my library, like deleting scroble song, as many players scrobles immediately, but I often skip song after few seconds and I don\'t want it my library. I also would like to see more artist info.
reviews.author: Tomasz Bystrek

reviews.title: Crap
reviews.comment: It\'s just crap, plain and simple.  You don\'t get free radio even if you login with your Xbox details.  Which is stupid as hell why would I pay to stream on my phone when pc and Xbox is free?  I already have a last fm access on 2 thirds of my devices,  surely I\'d have to be dumb to subscribe for the remaining 3rd.  I don\'t think you guys thought this through.
reviews.author: Stephen Butterworth

reviews.title: What is the point?
reviews.comment: I have this on my Xbox and love the radio feature, but I can\'t listen to it on my cell phone? Stupid waste of time. Deleting now.
reviews.author: Jim Hecker

reviews.title: Does not play on phone Canada
reviews.comment: Why does it not play radio on phone in Canada but does on computer and android tablet? 2 stars :\'(  Also does it really need access to pretty much every thing on my device?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Goodbye
reviews.comment: No \'radio\' available in the UK now?  It\'s useless to me without it.  It\'s not like I\'m in a third-world country or something.  Also, am I the only person who isn\'t getting \'bio\' information anymore?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs a serious redesign
reviews.comment: I pretty much only use the app for scrobbles. The interface is so outdated and clunky that I\'d rather just never open it. I\'d honestly rather use the mobile site. This app feels like an unfinished project that an intern scraped together over a weekend.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: New Update Dislikes My Xoom
reviews.comment: I don\'t know about of any improvements since the last update since i can\'t log in. Ruins the whole point of having this app, doesn\'t it? Will probably uninstall soon.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Error in scrobbling
reviews.comment: It keeps scrobbling one same song even if I\'m not listening to it. I got 52 led Zeppelin scrobbles in one week and I didn\'t listen to that at all!
reviews.author: J\303\264nathas Lucas Souza

reviews.title: Paid subscription?
reviews.comment: Radio is free on my Xbox.. why do I have to pay for the mobile app? Especially when you are still bombarded with ads? There is not one reason to use this instead of iheart radio.
reviews.author: TheHammerAndAnvil

reviews.title: Not fully working
reviews.comment: It seems I\'m missing the most important feature. The radio! Completely pointlessbif I can\'t stream music... galaxy note 2
reviews.author: Stephen Johnston

reviews.title: Poor navigation
reviews.comment: Can\'t get back to home screen after it scrobbles poweramp.  Stuck on an artist bio. Have to remove app from memory. Otherwise does what I need it to
reviews.author: Campbell Sinclair

reviews.title: My friends have had this awhile and didn\'t pay anything
reviews.comment: Whenever they started charging ppl idk, but no way I\'m paying for something you can get free! Plus they don\'t respond to emails. Plenty better apps out there, also I hear mobile version sucks anyway
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Get Scrobbling...
reviews.comment: Well worth the small subscription fee. Open your mind, get scrobbling and listen to a world of new music. 5 Stars all the way! Samsung Galaxy S II GT-I9100
reviews.author: Jon D

reviews.title: Forced subscription for free service.
reviews.comment: You get a number of plays then the app forces you to subscribe for $3 per month just to use the same program on their website, which is free with the OPTION to subscribe for added benefit. I will edit my star rating when the subscription is no longer mandatory for the app, even if there are occasional ads like on the website, or other radio apps like Pandora.
reviews.author: Nicholas Martisofski

reviews.title: UI
reviews.comment: Needs new UI design and better artist and chart navigation. I can\'t even read artist bios. Scrobbling works great. I don\'t use the radio so no comment on that.
reviews.author: Corey Proulx
